name: Burrata
desp: Artisan cheese from Puglia, made with cow's milk, rennet, and cream, known for its creamy interior and rich flavor.

name: Prosciutto di Parma
desp: Cured ham from Parma, made with high-quality pigs and sea salt, known for its delicate flavor and texture.

name: Panino col Polpo
desp: Traditional sandwich from Bari with grilled octopus, bread, olive oil, parsley, salt, and pepper.

name: Pasta Carbonara
desp: Classic Roman pasta dish with spaghetti, guanciale, egg yolks, and Pecorino Romano cheese.

name: Tagliatelle al Rag√π alla Bolognese
desp: Traditional dish from Bologna with tagliatelle pasta and a rich meat sauce made with minced beef and pork, and tomatoes.

name: Fritto Misto
desp: Mixed fried seafood, typically including shrimp, squid, and fish, lightly coated in flour and fried.

name: Linguine allo Scoglio
desp: Seafood pasta from Campania, made with linguine, clams, mussels, shrimp, and tomatoes.

name: Pasta alla Gricia
desp: Traditional pasta dish from Grisciano with guanciale, Pecorino Romano, and black pepper.

name: Bistecca alla Fiorentina
desp: Grilled T-bone steak from Florence, typically seasoned with olive oil, salt, and pepper, and served rare.

name: Parmigiana alla Napoletana
desp: Casserole dish from Campania with layered eggplant, tomato sauce, mozzarella, and Parmesan cheese.
